long_desc.thetext:
Not sure whether itâ€™s a problem with the dbus Python bindings used, or a problem inherent to firewalld but: $ gdbus introspect --system --dest org.fedoraproject.FirewallD1 --object-path /org/fedoraproject/FirewallD1 | grep -C 2 properties
-> No properties

IMHO we're correctly implementing all methods of the org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties interface. [1] [2]
For example gdbus call --system --dest org.fedoraproject.FirewallD1 --object-path /org/fedoraproject/FirewallD1/config/zone/0 --method org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties.GetAll org.fedoraproject.FirewallD1.config.zone
works for me and I've no idea what else do we need to make the properties introspectable. It might be a problem of D-Bus python bindings.
[1] http://pythonhosted.org/txdbus/dbus_overview.html [2] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4277814/how-to-handle-properties-of-a-dbus-interface-with-python

There is a long standing bug to add the needed functionality to dbus-python:
https://bugs.freedesktop.org/show_bug.cgi?id=26903
With the latest dbus-python package in Fedora 21 and the merge of the dbus.service.properties branch of firewalld we will have full property support also in the introspection data.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 22 development cycle. Changing version to '22'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora22

As the property support in python-dbus was refused by upstream and the patch for properties in python-dbus has been removed in Fedora rawhide the branch will not be merged.
A migration to another dbus library is needed to be able to provide visible properties in introspection data.
There is an issue for rolekit to work on this: https://github.com/libre-server/rolekit/issues/24

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase
Fixed in rawhide and F24-testing in package firewalld-0.4.1.2-1 or newer.
